intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves with fine hairs. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
